items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message: This alert is no longer in force due to improving weather conditions

floodArea.county: County Durham, Hartlepool, North Tyneside, South Tyneside, Sunderland

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
Coastal conditions should ease for the 17/09/22 high tide at 9:00. We will continue to monitor the forecast. We do not expect the need to re-issue this Alert today, 17/09/22. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible from now, 8am Saturday 17th September, until tomorrow morning. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels in Brundall and Reedham riverside areas. The current series of high spring tides has now reached its peak, and will fall away over the next few days, allowing the freshwater river flows to drain out to sea at low tide as normal again. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 8:30am tomorrow, Sunday 18th September.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
Coastal conditions should ease for Saturday 17/09/2022.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.  
We continue to monitor the situation.

Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: North Sea coast from Whitby to Filey

floodArea.county: East Riding of Yorkshire, North Yorkshire

items.message: This Flood Alert has been issued because some minor flooding to coastal roads and footpaths is likely on the morning tide between 06:30 AM and 10:30 AM on Saturday, 17/09/2022. Areas most at risk include Marine Royal Albert Drive in Scarborough, and exposed coastal roads and promenades where the combination of wave action and spray is expected to cause hazardous conditions. Please be careful along beaches and exposed coastal areas as waves and spray may be unpredictable. We continue to monitor the forecast closely. This message will be updated by 2PM on 17/09/2022, or as the situation changes.
This warning is no longer in force due to improving weather conditions
